Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but good value”
Reviews.Author: motohachi
Reviews.Content: Although you don't hear street noise, one crying baby really disturb your sleep. Staff was very nice and room was clean. Price was great - small room with 2 people costs only 370 pesos/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pjreddot
Reviews.Content: It's in a great location, near the Zocalo, metro stations, lots of food & restaurants around. The room we stayed in (king bed room) was really nice, clean & modern. Included was a bottle of water each per day, shampoo, soap etc. No fridge or breaky included. The restaurant was overpriced, but there's lots of food around to choose from. The main problem was the noise from outside. Our room faced the street & It was unbelievably noisy all night (I think it might be the case at most places in Mexico city on a busy road?). They have free internet & computers. No tour ideas from the front desk & not any atmosphere. Nice hotel for the price & good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, acceptable rooms, but bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Ewa_Z
Reviews.Content: Positives: - 5 minutes walk from the zocalo - 3 minutes walk from the nearest metro (Allende) - 2 minutes from main shopping street/Starbucks:) and bars - nice staff - helpful and English-speaking and patient with our attempts to speak Spanish - basic, but clean rooms, with a daily cleaning service Negatives: - rooms have windows to the main hall - this is not a problem privacy-wise in terms of what you see (curtains), but a big one in terms of what you hear. Rooms are separated from the hall with the some kind of an open window. BRING YOUR EARPLUGS - that way you can have a peaceful night. Otherwise you will be forced to listen to the drunken songs of other guests, the hotel staff does not seem to care much.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy sleeping in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cimicak
Reviews.Content: The bigest advantage of this hotel is it´s location - 200 or 300m west from the Plaza Mayor, close to several Metro-stations, lots of shops and eating possibilities within short walk-distance. The rooms are basic but clean, hot shower, TV and even safe represent satisfactory equipment for this low-price category of accomodation. The main problem is the construction of the hotel (majority /if not all/ room-doors lead to the same huge "quasi-atrium" whereas the doors allow the noise to come out or in. Due to that you can share for free all imaginable TV programs (at the same time) and later on (espetially on weekends when many couples use the rooms for few hours only) judge the quality of sexual life of your twenty "nearest neighbours". The hotel is a good choice for people who primarily intend to enjoy the night life of Mexico city and bad option for those who want to rest after strenuous day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service for low price”
Reviews.Author: abtraveler_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights, great central location, nice rooms, two computers with internet. Big comfortable rooms with thick walls. We took one of the king sized rooms with a view of the street, it was cheaper and (in my estimation) nicer than the "plus" rooms we saw, which were more costly. Though there was a lot of street car noise in the am.

Reviews.Title: “The best place for price and security”
Reviews.Author: Xochipillitzin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principal in Mexico City means business. They are polite without being intruding, clean without cleaning you out and always completely safe in a very chaotic environment like any city of over 25 million people can be. They have four different floors which would fit any budget, but even the cheap rooms are clean and the shared bathrooms, although inadequate for a full house, remain clean most of the time. They have free wi-fi and a very efficient crew that will always stay out of your way. Most of the cheap rooms are taken by traveling merchants and artisans and backpackers. The larger rooms are usually occupied by families or more affluent people. Don't think of this as a luxury or even a boutique hotel. This is a hotel in the more traditional sense, where you can find a bed and a shower for very little money, yet very decent. One of the drawbacks of course is that being in the center of the largest city in the world, from time to time and depending on your room you may find it noisy, but who comes to Mexico City to sleep?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pfeifea
Reviews.Content: Located close to the Zocalo, this hotel is close to the busyness of the city, especially late at night, so if you're a light sleeper, this might not be the best place for you. However, everything was clean and the service was great...I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Luis de la Paz, Guanajuato, MÃ©xico
Reviews.Title: “Great economic option in the heart of Mexico City's Centro Historico”
Reviews.Author: Rjensen719
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that, if you are looking for a basic and affordable option in the center of Mexico City, then I highly recommend Hotel Principal! The location can't be beat (right between the Zocalo and the Alameda, relatively safe, close to everything, and easily accessible by metro stops Allende or Bellas Artes, by taxi, or on foot), and I paid just $33 USD per night for a king-size bed! The rooms are very basic, and a little worn (a burn from a clothes iron in on the carpet and a cigarrette burn in one of the blankets). But it is clean and the staff is friendly and changed our sheets and towels every single day. Some complaints I saw from other travelers (noise, TV remote controls, etc...) were not a problem for me. And really, if you are expecting something better for less than $35 per night in the center of Mexico City, then you simply have unrealistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; too bad about the noisy nightclub close by.”
Reviews.Author: aquamaureen
Reviews.Content: We were generally happy with our three-day stay. We loved the location and the staff were pleasant. We chose room 303 because of the large windows opening onto the street. However, there was an extremely noisy nightclub very close by which provided more background noise than we would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “room 417 a New Renovated one”
Reviews.Author: Antoines
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night 23 january, in the renovated and new rooms in the 4th floor. i got room number 417 was clean, New and with a King size bed, there was a safe box available for a 20usd deposit and returned when check out. 2 bottles of water each day, and an inmaculate bathroom. the location is SUPERB right in the downtown area just 4 blocks from cathedral and zocalo, in the middle of a pedestrian street called MADERO full with restaurants, bars, entretaiment, shops and police men walking there 24 hours 7 days a week. Latinoamericana tower just 2 blocks ahead. Delicious TACOS AL PASTOR right in the front of the Hotel: SALON CORONA you have to try POTZOLLCALLI restaurant near the hotel and try THE POZOLE ROJO WITH PORK MEAT was awesome i want more and more. if you stay in the proper hotel ask for a renovated room in the 4th floor and you wont be disapointed TRUST ME.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value, clean and nicely appointed, sometimes noisy”
Reviews.Author: arjunDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in el centro blocks away from the Zocalo and the revitalizing center of Mexico City. We stayed for three nights in the brand new rooms on the 4th floor (5th for us Americans). The room recently added/remodeled with wood floors and tasteful convenient furniture/lighting. Although it wasn't as large as some of the other rooms seem to be, the high ceilings, brand new fixtures and lighting,and wood floors more than made up for it. It was decorated in a very modern style with nice recessed fluorescent lighting over the bed and around the bathroom mirror. They kept it immaculately clean daily, replacing all the sheets and towels. The king-size bed had a comfortable mattress. The entrance is small (I think to make more space for their very large restaurant), but once you're inside it opens up into classic Mexico city style with walkways along the sides of a courtyard with the doors all opening up onto walkways lining the courtyard. The weather was a little chilly while we were there, but the glass roof on the courtyard kept it a little warmer, yet still open feeling and bright. The one possible negative mentioned in the other reviews here was noise from other guests. It was generally quiet, but one night (a Friday) my wife was woken up by the sound of someone loudly having sex. She was more amused than anything else, and I sleep through pretty much anything so it didn't bother us much. Notably they gave us a discount and the room only cost us a little over $20 per night. I was reminded of a couple of years ago when I stayed in a much smaller, but similarly centrally located and appointed room in el Barri Gotic in Barcelona for more than 10 times that amount. My wife and I plan on coming back. Cleanliness, and a decent bathroom/shower are probably the two most important things to my wife and I in a hotel, and the Hotel Principal exceeded our expectations for far less then we have paid in other places in Mexico City (where my wife is from). One other note, they advertise free WiFi access, but the signal was week and access spotty in our room, to the point of being almost unusable. They had a computer in the lobby you could use, and the access might have been better in another room or in the restaurant. (I saw some people using the WiFi in the restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value - If You Ask for the Right Room”
Reviews.Author: AdicaRoy
Reviews.Content: I had a room with two beds for three women on four separate nights in late April and found this hotel to be the best value for the dollar I've ever spent on a room, but ONLY after we switched rooms. If you book a room at this hotel, be sure to insist on having an end room - the rooms on either end of the building facing the street are enormous, with great bathroom facilities, high ceilings and comfortable beds. The rooms on the interior of the hotel are dorm-style hostel rooms in which the shower in the bathroom proper and the beds have thin pillows. Additionally, the noise from the hallway into the interior rooms is vastly more intrusive than the street noise in the end rooms. The location of this hotel is a major selling point. It is in the Centro Historico with one block walk to the Bellas Artes area and two blocks to the Central Zocalo and major historical landmarks. Mexico City is hugely spread out geographically, so you can book a private car (priced slightly higher than a taxi but still reasonably) from the man at the front desk - it is a 15-minute ride to Zona Rosa, Roma and a bit further to Polanco. There is a great Metro station three blocks away, and charming places to eat breakfast or go dancing, and great bakeries all in the neighborhood. An additional selling point at this hotel is the hospitable front desk help who, though they spoke little English, muddle through our medicore Spanish to change hotel rooms, pay our bills, book cars and get directions. Also, there is a restaurant next door that, although it caters mainly to tourists, has sangria that will knock your socks off. I would recommend this hotel for location, value, and hospitable service.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nexttripp
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in room #301. It had a large long room with 3 double beds in it and 2 side tables, then an adjacent room with one double bed, 2 dressers, side table, safe and TV (Get remote from front desk) that could be viewed from the other 3 beds (if the center doors are left open), closet and a very large bathroom with shower. The towels were soft and thick. The window opened to the street but I felt no need to use ear plugs at night (which was not the norm on this trip). I did find that another rooms TV noise came in but they did eventually turn it off. If there was a family or group of friend traveling together this is definitely the room to have as it was huge. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of Mexico City's best bargains !”
Reviews.Author: WolfieBrooklyn_N_Y_
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at Hotel Principal. Yes, it is noisy , but as a native New Yorker and budget-conscious traveller , I am used to that . At $25 a night for a single room with a private bathroom, T.V. , 24/7 service, and a charming , accommodating staff , it is definitely a step above your average youth hostel.I am a 43 yr. old single female who enjoys traveling alone , so I really appreciate the the fact that there is an all-night hotel staff and an all- night bodega just across the street. I don't speak any Spanish beyond "taco" and "hola!", but the entire staff from the front desk to the maids (who keep the rooms immaculately clean) can not be helpful enough to attend to you. The central location is a huge plus, only a few blocks away from the Alameda Park, Zocolo, and the Metro stations that can take you all over this wonderful, metropolitan city rich in culture, art, and history . If you are young at heart, have an adventuresome spirit , and willing to rough it out with the boisterous regulars who return again and again, Hotel Principal will become,as they say on their calling card,"Su casa en Mexico" !

Reviews.Title: “Has Definately Gone Downhill Since I Last Stayed There”
Reviews.Author: IHateNoice
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times over the years and while it was never a great place it has been good enough due mainly to its location and the price. This time it was next to impossible. Firstly, I called a month or so in advance and requested a specific room or one exactly like it. I was told it would be "no problem". When I arrived I was told it was a problem as those rooms were not available. This hotel has always been loud at night but it is much worse than in the past. I realize a hotel for $20.00 US nightly is not going to attract the highest class individuals as a rule but there are some truely low class people using this place. People returned all hours of the night and were clearly drunk, making a lot of noice, group singing (3am) and slamming doors, laughing very loud. They thought nothing of it. There was one drunk going from room to room asking for sex. I heard a lady in another room come out into the hall area and demand that everyone just "shut up as she has been trying to sleep for hours". I spoke to the front desk clerk and the owner and neither did anything about it. The least the can do is to ask people to hold down the noice when they return after about 11pm but this never crosses their minds. Secondly, about 5am each morning a hotel employee or an employee of the restaurant (overpriced food, not very good ) begins to slam metal doors while emptying trash. This happened each morning. This USED to be a great place based on price and location but no longer is. I would higher NOT recommend it anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, inexpensive, extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: limegreenchalk
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on its location, cost, and positive reviews. My stay was four nights over May 29 - June 2, 2008. I made my reservation through the hotel website (www.hotelprincipal.com.mx), and the staff were kind enough to tell me that the airport taxi would cost $127. I was given a room with two beds, but only charged the single rate ($240). There is a Super Soya next to the hotel, where you can purchase water and snacks. On the other side is a restaurant that opens at 8 AM, where you can get breakfast. My room was on the third floor and well back from the street, so street noise was not a problem. A large youth group checked-in just before me, so it was a little noisy at night. I was able to sleep decently, given that I do not normally sleep well in hotels. The room was not air-conditioned, but did have windows that open and a vent over the door. It was stuffy during the day, but not too bad at night. The room was made up daily and was acceptably clean. It contained a safe, but I could not figure out the locking mechanism and never used it. I had trouble figuring out how to unlock my room, but once I did, I did not have problems. There were a few things I wasn't crazy about. My shower did not drain well, so I showered piecemeal. The water pressure was poor, but the shower got hot fairly quickly. On my first morning, I observed (dead) cockroaches on the stairwell. Thankfully, by evening they were gone, and I didn't see anymore during my stay. Overall, for what I paid for my stay, the hotel more than met my expectations. I was five minutes from the Zocalo and the Palacio de Belles Artes, which was really convenient. On my first day, I struggled with the altitude, so I appreciated being able to go back to the hotel to rest. The front desk spoke fairly good English and was able to assist in calling a taxi for me. If I visited Mexico City again, I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value”
Reviews.Author: jloudercp
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principal is very well located and a very good place to stay for a low price. When I was there it cost $26 per night. It is in a nice old Spanish style building with very high ceilings and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are cleaned daily and some have a nice view of the street. It is very close to el Zocalo and the Alameda, and the concierge is very helpful with tourist information. Free internet in the lobby and a laid back ambiance. It is not very quiet at night, but bring your earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: traveler551
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at Hotel Principal and was quite pleased. The rooms (though basic) were clean and serviced daily. The staff was extremely helpful, the price was excellent, and they provide free internet access in the lobby. Additionaly, the location is excellent--very quick walks to the Zocalo, Reforma, and several metro stations for anywhere else in the city. TV (with some 40 channels) and phone in the room. The only complaint I had was the noise level--the rooms are not soundproof and noise tended to be an issue at night. However, bring earplugs and you'll be fine. Overall, a clean, safe, and affordable little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For this price I did expect much less than what I got......”
Reviews.Author: ichaves25
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in this hotel. I was a woman traveling all by myself to Mexico to see Roger Waters. I've never been to Mexico before but I got to say this hotel was great. First thing is close to everything. Just in front of the hotel there is a little store open 24/7 where you can buy snacks, drinks, etc. Around the corner there is a 24/7 drugstore... very convenient. Close to Starbucks, Burguer King, Sears.... two blocks away from Zocalo and 5 blocks away from Garibaldi..... For $20 a night I received a very decent room (I have stayed in rooms like this in Best western paying $90 a night) with a/c, tv, hot water, nice bed..... The service is good, not great but I mean... at that price you can't expect a service such as the one in Ritz Carlton..... If I ever go back to Mexico... i will stay here, that's for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Principal is located in a great location, just blocks away from sights like the Zocalo, Palacio Municipal, Templo Mayor, Palacio de Bellas Artes and the Alameda park. Many restaurants, ranging from expensive to cheap, and shops (sporting, music, books, clothing, shoes, etc.)surround it.The Allende Metro station is a couple of minutes away. You cannot find a better location. The downside was that the hotel was very noisy and I slept terribly every night for the week that we were there. We could hear the T.V. from other rooms, babies crying, people being intimate, phones ringing, people coming back late, etc. Some noise always woke me up every day in the middle of the night and it was common to be awoken several times.I strongly recommend that earplugs be taken. The pillows are also very hard and because the courtyard is enclosed (glass ceiling) air circulation is poor (we had an inner courtyard room). Cigarette smoke from other guests would filter into our room. Other than that, the rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. They provided us with nice, big, towels everyday and drinking water in a jar. We paid $320 pesos/night for a room with 2 double beds. It was for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Good inexpensive place close to the Zocolo”
Reviews.Author: LRae
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hotel Principal for several days in 2002. We asked for one of the large L-shaped rooms facing the street. The room had 4 beds, so my kids each had their own. The downside was the terrific din from the street! There is at least one disco with all-night very loud music. At the time, there was also an all-night construction site with the usual steam hammers, rip saws, etc. My advice is to take earplugs, or take one of the interior rooms, if you can't sleep through loud noises. Hotel Principal is located in a 400 year old building with high arched brick ceilings. The rooms are old looking but clean and neat. There is plenty of hot water. There is one small service lift. The staff is friendly and some speak a little English. Many travellers from all over stay there. The Principal is located in an excellent area, with a good bakery just a couple blocks away. It is an easy walk to the Zocolo and several good restaurants. There are two restaurants flanking it on either side--one, Leonesa Parilla, is fancy and rather expensive, but serves excellent food (my kids liked their burgers and shakes.) The other is a vegetarian smoothy bar, a good place to get licuados or ice cream. Stay at the Hotel Principal, but bring your earplugs. Don't forget to leave a flower or token for the Virgin who watches over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great! At the heart of Mexico DF...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great! Located at the very heart of Mexico DF with the lowest price for such a kind of hotel. Only five minutes walk from the main attractions in Mexico DF! An old fashioned house, very confortable and with all facilities availables requested for a nice stay! Ask for a room at the inside balcony! Only one trouble, when I was there there was no breakfast service but ask of a small backery at the next street. So enjoy it!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Principal
HotelInfo.Address: Bolivar, 29 | Centro Histórico, Mexico City 06000, Mexico
